page.title: 01OLD KILPATRICK
page.content: The area covered by this block consists of the villages of{Old} {Kilpatrick}and{Bowling}on the north bank of the{River Clyde}and also takes in a very small part of{Erskine}on the south bank. The dominant feature of this area is the gigantic{Erskine} {Bridge}which spans the river linking the two villages with the new town. There are no major industries in the area.Locals commute to the nearby towns of{Clydebank, Dumbarton}and {Erskine} or the{City of Glasgow} to work. The{population}of Old Kilpatrick and Bowling taken in the census of 1981 was{2997,}and{446}respectively. The whole area lies in the{Clyde} {Valley}with the{Old Kilpatrick Hills} to the north, making it{a pleasant and {and attractive place to live. .
